intro: Stylogyne carautae, commonly known as the Carauta stylogynum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Stylogyne carautae is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
